page.title: 01St Dennis Village
page.content: St Dennis Village and parish area on the edge of Chinaa clay area in mid Cornwall on a hillside facing NW. St Dennis is a large village of 2,000 inhabitants with 3 methodist chapels and an anglican church which is 1000 ft above sea level. besides the village there are 2 hamlets,enniscaven and trerice. Most men work in china clay production. Most of the rest of the Parish is now one large farm of 550 acres or moorland. The river Fal forms virtuallly 1/3 of the Parish boundary and on the other side of the river there is a branch railway to Newquay, the main A30 Spine Road nad neighbouring Indian queens village (with its pocahuntas connection) with its cemetery Domellick 8formerly Domelliock) Manor is entioned in the first Domesday Book.
